Character Creation
This is the Character Creator. Here you can set starting aspects of your character like their origins, starting ability scores, and starting skills. You can always return to this page from Options.
Submit
Leave
Submit will have you accept any changes made on this page and add your selections to your character. You will then be sent to Class Advancement to select class(es) to level up. Leave will ignore any changes made here and return you to the Character Sheet.
Background
Full Name
A character's full name. This is for self referential use.
Display Name
This is the name that is displayed when your character speaks.
 
Path
Path broadly describes a character's role in the game.
 
Primary Affinity
Characters that are able to cast spells will have an elemental affinity that ties them to one of the five primary elements.
Ancestry
Ancestry
Every character belongs to an ancestry, one of the many creatures that exist in Wuxing. The ancestry you choose contributes to your characterâ€™s identity in an important way, by establishing a general appearance and the natural talents available to you.

Ability Scores
Starting Scores
You may spend a number of points to increase your ability scores, from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 10. These are added to your ancestry ability scores to determine your final starting scores.
Points 40 / 40

Growths
As your character advances in level they will increase their ability scores based on the growth rates of their class and starting growths. Each time you level you will gain progress in each ability score (and some statistics) equal to your growths total. All characters begin with a pool of 12 points. These points can be assigned to each of the eight ability scores, to a maximum of 3 points in any stat. Each point will grant the ability score +0.2 growth.

This page is divided into two main sections, ancestry skills and bonus skills. The ancestry section holds tallies for the skills you are selecting. Extra skills is intended for any additional skills you may take through advancement. Submit will have you accept any changes made on this page and add your selections to your character. Leave will ignore any changes made here and return you to the Character Sheet.
Ancestry Skills
Defensive Skills
Reset
Physical Defensive
Points 1 / 1
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Brace
Brace represents a character's ability to resist a physical force and shrug it off by holding strong and blocking. Common uses of this defense are to prevent a fast attack from harming the character or to resist the effect of many pushing effects.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Presence
Presence is a character's ability to force their will over their environment. It is used to disrupt ether as it means to affect a character.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Reflex
Reflex is used when a character could quickly react to a situation with movement. It is usually used to avoid powerful attacks or to get out of the way of harmful effects that only need to touch the character like a fireball.
Sensory Defensive
Points 1 / 1
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Insight
Insight represents a character's ability to parse conversation and judge mental states. This defense is typically used when information is being hidden in text or speech or to detect when someone is concealing their true thoughts.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Notice
Notice is the ability to see or hear sudden changes in your environment. It is typically used to counter a character's stealth attempts or to hear a distant or quiet noise.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Resolve
Resolve is the ability to persevere when your will is attacked. It is used to defend against intimidation and to stay motivated when desperation sets in.
Physical Skills
Points 1 / 1
Reset
Martial
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Brawling
This is the skill to use one's own body to fight. The combat style has a focus on quick actions, allowing more maneuverability in their attacks in exchange for less damage.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Finesse
This is the skill to strike at a foe dextrously, using precision to target weaknesses. Weapons in this skill tend to have the flexibility of being used in melee or thrown and are well balanced for striking fast.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Marksmanship
The skill of using a bow or firearm. These weapons have the most variety in weapon ranges, but typically are ineffective in melee.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Might
These weapons are large, allowing the wielder to swing them with all their strength. They often come with ways to either smash through defenses or simply to break a defense more easily.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Polearm
This is the skill for striking in melee with a weapon that is long and has substantial reach. These weapons will often feature increased threat range, allowing one to strike at more distant foes.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Throw
When one strikes at a foe or aims for a location by throwing an object, it is typical to use the throw skill.
Body
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Acrobatics
Your Acrobatics check covers your attempt to stay on your feet in a tricky situation, such as when youâ€™re trying to run across a sheet of ice, balance on a tightrope, or stay upright on a rocking shipâ€™s deck.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Athletics
Your Athletics check covers movement through an environment such as when climbing, jumping, or swimming.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Fortitude
Fortitude is a character's ability to resist environmental or internal harm such as from severe heat or cold, poisons or sickness.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Legerdemain
Legerdemain is sleight-of-hand skill that gives a character the ability to snag, hide, and pass off small objects.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Physique
The Physique skill represents a characterâ€™s raw strength and endurance. It is the base skill for actions that allow one to shove or grapple and can be used to allow one to lift or carry objects that may fall outside normal rules.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Stealth
Make a Stealth check when you attempt to conceal yourself from enemies, palm an object, slink past guards, slip away without being noticed, or sneak up on some one without being seen or heard.
Technical
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Artisan
This skill includes several different forms of artistic impression such as through drawing, sculpting, handcrafting of fine objects, and conveying art and information through images and technique.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Cook
Food is important for survival, so making it enjoyable is a craft of great appreciation. This skill requires cook's utensils in order to cook most food at a minimum, while different dishes may require access to a stove, oven, or other large appliances.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Heal
Heal is used to perform medical procedures such as administering drugs, performing first aid, and conducting surgeries. It includes long-term medical support for disease and illness, and the skill can be used to diagnose a characterâ€™s medical condition.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Herbalism
The skill to create medicinal and chemical compounds such as drugs, perfumes, and poisons.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Mechanical
This skill covers building, repairing, and disabling mechanical devices such as locks, tools, and machinery.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Pilot
When attempting to drive a vehicle of any kind, the pilot skill often governs most checks.
Mental Skills
Points 1 / 1
Reset
Magic
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Assault
These spells quickly form ether into a physical substance. Because the ether is formed quickly, these spells are well suited for launching at targets in a combat situation at the cost of keeping the ether stable for more than a few seconds.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Conjure
These spells form ether into a form of energy and stabilzes it so that it can linger in this form. Conjured magic is often unable to last for long and must be consumed quickly else disperse into ether.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Enchant
Spells that imbue a target with temporary or permanent change. These spells can typically cause effects in creatures such as emboldening their strength or heal their wounds.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Ethereal
Ethereal spells are unique in that they don't create any obvious physical manifestation but rather affect ether and the ethereal plane directly.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Field
These spells affect existing terrain and environments by either modifying it or adding to it.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Structure
Spells that transform ether into physical objects and materials and reform it. Some spells in this class can affect physical aspected-materials and reform it as well.
Social
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Charm
Enticing, fascinating, and endearing others to you on a personal basis. It can be used to win someone over emotionally through friendliness, joy, and an ability to read a situation.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Deception
Telling convincing lies, as well as feigning emotion, belief, or frame of mind. Deception can encompass everything from misleading others through ambiguity to telling outright lies. This skill is also used to convince others of a disguise.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Intimidation
When you attempt to influence someone through overt threats, hostile actions, and physical violence, you make an Intimidation check. Examples include trying to pry information out of a prisoner, convincing street thugs to back down from a confrontation, or using the edge of a broken bottle to convince a sneering vizier to reconsider a decision. When intimidating others you target their resolve.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Leadership
Leadership is the ability to direct and motivate others. This skill is especially helpful in situations where the will of a teammate is shaken or someone is being asked to do something uncomfortable.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Negotiation
Negotiation governs a characterâ€™s ability to apply their charisma, tactics, and knowledge of situational psychology in order to create a better position when making deals.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Performance
Your Performance check determines how well you can delight an audience with music, dance, acting, storytelling, or some other form of entertainment.
Knowledge
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Academics
This type of knowledge includes college subjects such as history, arithmetic, chemistry, technology, and magical theory.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Culture
Your culture check measures your ability to recall lore about a civilization's practices, philosophies, laws, and religions.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Investigation
This is used to actively search for for clues or anything out of sorts. You might deduce the location of a hidden object, discern from the appearance of a wound what kind of weapon dealt it, or determine the weakest point in a tunnel that could cause it to collapse.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Nature
Nature is the recall skill that governs the natural world. You would use a nature check to get information on geography, the planes, and creatures such as human and animal physiology and the nature of spirits.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Tracking
Make a Tracking check to follow tracks, hunt wild game, or guide your group through wastelands.
▾ ▸
▣ ▢ Vocation
Vocational knowledge deals with subjects related to trades, professions, and occupations. Things like journalism, crafting, business, and so on.

Fighter Lv.0
The fighter is about survival. This battle hardened warrior will keep himself from falling through many means to self-heal, aid, and even shrug off wounds.

Feature Second Wind Gain a Defensive Skill Technique. Gain a Combat Skill Technique. Shrug It Off Gain a Defensive Skill Technique. Always Armored Gain a Defensive Skill Technique. Always Armored + Gain a Combat Skill Technique. Gain a Defensive Skill Technique. Undaunted
 
Fighter Techniques
JobClassSecond WindBase: Free, 1/Round
Resources: 1 Vitality

You take a breath and refocus your senses. You restore your HP to full.

Shrug It OffAugment: Second Wind

You may remove one condition that is affecting you.

UndauntedAugment: Second Wind
Requirements: You have a wound.
Resources: 3 Mana; 1 Chakra

Remove 1 Wound from yourself. In 5 minutes, or when you choose to do so early, you take 1 Wound.

PassiveClassAlways ArmoredBase

You have +1 Armor.

Blocking ExpertAugment: Always Armored

You have +5 Block.

Interceptor Lv.0
The interceptor is an expert in disrupting others. Prefering weapons with increased threat, interceptors protect their allies by stopping the movement of advancing enemies.
 
Level
 
Prerequisites Trained in Notice and Polearm

Interceptor Techniques
JobClassPreemptive StrikeBase: Reaction, 1/Round
Traits:
Armament undefined
Trigger: The target moves within your threat.
Target: One target
Weapon
 vs. BR DC

You perform a melee attack against the triggering character.

On Hit: The target stops moving immediately and loses any unused movement.
Preemptive StaggerAugment: Preemptive Strike
Resources: 1 Mana
On Hit: The target gains the Staggered condition.
Critical MaimAugment: Preemptive Strike
Resources: 3 Mana
On Hit: The target loses 1 Quick Action or 1 Full Action.
PassiveClassLungeBase

If your weapon has threat, your threat with the weapon increases by 1.

Step ForwardAugment: Lunge

Whenever you melee attack you may move 1 space.

Physician Lv.0
The physician is a medical practitioner and expert healer. Their Emergency Care allows them to heal allies and provide them with barrier, eventually allowing them to heal wounds. And if faster healing is necessary, their First aid allows them to perform healing as a Quick action.

Pugilist Lv.0
The pugilist is a martial artist and athlete whose own body is a weapon. They feature an incredible method of getting in and out of combat with their Sprint. When they are in combat, their Flurry of Blows allows them to attack more often and combo off their foes' conditions.

Pugilist Techniques
JobClassFlurry of BlowsBase: Quick, 1/Round
Target: One target
Weapon
 vs. BR DC

You strike at a foe with multiple strikes. Make two melee attacks against one target. Both attacks must use the Brawling skill.

Throw DownAugment: Flurry of Blows
Requirements: The target must be Launched.
Resources: 2 Mana
On Hit: The target is knocked prone after either attack.
Stunning StrikeAugment: Flurry of Blows
Requirements: The target must be Staggered.
Resources: 3 Mana; 1 Chakra
On Hit: The target gains the Stunned condition until the end of the Round.
PassiveClassSprintBase

Once per round, you may move up to half your speed. You do not become engaged during this movement.

Burst SprintAugment: Sprint

You may perform Sprint twice, however the second time costs a Quick action.

Disciples of Acumen
Scholar Lv.0
The scholar is an expert in history and uses it to always be prepared. In addition to history, scholars are typically knowledgable in a broad array of subjects and will sometimes use it to educate others. In combat, a scholar will use their preparedness to avoid bad situations and help their allies avoid them too.
 
Level
 
Prerequisites Trained in History

Feature Foresight Gain a Knowledge Skill Technique. Gain a Defensive Skill Technique. Eclectic Knowledge Gain a Knowledge Skill Technique. Saw That Coming Gain a Knowledge Skill Technique. Point of Clarity Gain a Defensive Skill Technique. Gain a Knowledge Skill Technique. As You May Recall
 
Scholar Techniques
JobClassForesightBase: Reaction, 1/Round
Trigger: Trigger conditions vary.

Your studies have left you with uncanny prescience. When a condition in the following list is met, you may perform the action.
â€¢ When you fail a recall knowledge check and used a specialized knowledge, try again.
â€¢ When initiative is determined, add +2 to your initiative.
â€¢ When initiative is determined, gain 1 Mana.
â€¢ When you are surprised, you may choose to act in the surprise round.
â€¢ When an adjacent ally starts their turn, you allow the character to use the Dash technique once for free.

Saw That ComingAugment: Foresight
Resources: 1 Mana

Instead you have the following options:
â€¢ When a character becomes engaged with you, you may move half your speed.
â€¢ When an adjacent ally is targetted by an attack, you may use the shove technique on them before the attack occurs. If the ally is not in the attacker's range, the attack automatically misses.
â€¢ When an adjacent ally gains a condition that wasnâ€™t caused by one of their own techniques, clear the condition.

This augment can only be used 1/Rest

As You May RecallAugment: Foresight
Resources: 1 Chakra

Instead you may declare a flashback scene. The scene cannot be more than 1 minute long and having happened no more than a day's time. The scene may show you having prepared for an outcome. This may come in the form of having purchased/acquired a necessary item or having gathered information related to the present.

This flashback must be possible in accordance to established events. The GM may declare you need to perform a skill check to have the scene occur. The GM is the final arbiter of whether a flashback can be established and what the consequences are.

This augment can only be used 1/Day

PassiveClassEclectic KnowledgeBase

Whenever a nearby character fails a recall knowledge check and you have not yet attempted to perform the same check, you may perform the same check with +1 advantage.

Point of ClarityAugment: Eclectic Knowledge

Whenever a nearby character fails a recall knowledge check and you are trained in the same skill, you may add +4 to their check by correcting any gaps in their knowledge.
